meanings.definition: A class of hydrocarbons derived from petroleum, used in fuels and lubricants.
meanings.sent1: The paraffines in the fuel help make the car run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The paraffines are essential components of many types of oils.
meanings.sent3: The paraffines in the gasoline decided to have a race to see who could burn the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The paraffines in the engine danced together, creating a harmonious movement.
meanings.sent5: As the paraffines flowed through the pipes, they carried energy to the entire system.

meanings.definition: A type of wax used in candles and polishes.
meanings.sent1: She used paraffines to make the candles burn longer.
meanings.sent2: The paraffines added a glossy finish to the wooden furniture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous paraffines in the candle decided to play a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The paraffines on the floor gleamed like a river of liquid gold.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of the paraffines filled the room, creating a cozy atmosphere.
